key_points: A student from Bristol Borough High School was arrested for making a shooting threat.
The threat led to the closure of Bristol Borough School District facilities on Monday.
School to reopen Tuesday with extra police presence.
The threat was reported through the Safe2Say tip system, mentioning a plan to shoot up the high school.
Sgt. Joe Moors, acting leader of the borough police, reported the arrest early Monday with help from the Bucks County District Attorney's Office and Bucks County Juvenile Probation Department.
The student faces charges of making terroristic threats and disorderly conduct in juvenile court.
No weapons were found with the student.
The student allegedly mentioned a "specific plan and specific threat."
This incident follows a recent shooting in Oxford, Michigan that resulted in four student deaths.
Acting Superintendent Dr. Thomas Shaffer communicated the event's details to parents in a letter.
spokespersons: Sgt. Joe Moors (Acting leader, Borough Police Department)
Dr. Thomas F. Shaffer (Acting Superintendent, Bristol Borough School District)
